file_content.text: It's time you got going, Legate.
Come in. Can we have some privacy?
Kaliyo, right? Let me show you around.
Do it right, maybe I'll show you something.
Be careful, agent.
Vector, am I right? Let's take a tour.
Your aura spikes like a signal between stars.
Come in. Hunter, would you mind...?
I should get to my ship. Long flight ahead.
Four months ago, I start getting messages from a source in the Empire. Claims to be a Cipher agent.
Now a factory's in ruins and here we are. I'm starting to think you might be real.
I came a long way to find you. If the Empire knew....
We've got a lot to talk about.
They won't. We'll take care of that.
You don't trust me. I wouldn't, either.
I understand your hesitation.
Ever since I got here, I've been treated like the villain.
I'm tired of being suspect.
You have my sympathy, but can you blame us?
I got a copy of your personnel file. Says you were "traumatized" on Eradication Day.
Ten thousand people dead, so you could finish a mission. That what made you want to flip?
I'm tired of death, sir.
I lost faith in the Empire.
And the truth of it is... killing is all the Empire does. I can't ignore that any longer.
We've been asking around about you; all we got are sketchy details about Darth Jadus's "new regime."
People are suffering on Dromund Kaas. Sith leading rituals in the street... that what made you want to flip?
It isn't Jadus alone. It's the whole system that gave him power.
I lost faith in the Empire.
He let the world burn. He won. Now the Dark Council's praising his glories.
That's the Sith way, isn't it?
I got a copy of your personnel file. Says you were "traumatized" when you learned Darth Jadus's dirty secret.
A Dark Council member running a terrorist network. Murdering civilians. That what made you want to flip?
The Sith should represent strength. It's why they deserve to lead.
I lost faith in the Empire.
But Darth Jadus... embodied corruption. If a man like that can rise to the Dark Council, what does that mean?
It means strength alone doesn't make a great leader.
You know so much, why don't you tell me why I came here?
What do you think?
Maybe the Chiss taught you right from wrong. Or maybe you just couldn't take it any more.
You used to be an assassin. You've done a lot of bad things. Now it's time to change.
Because even Imperials can tell right from wrong.
I want to help the Republic win this war. That's all that matters.
My reasons are my own.
Why people do things always matters. Jedi say it's the difference between light and dark.
Saber?
Tell the deck another card is in play. Code name: "Legate."
Acknowledged. Tell her congratulations.
Acknowledged. Tell him congratulations.
I'm prepping operations on the planet Taris, couple other places. Join up with your forces there, I'll give you your first job.
You're on my team now, Legate. A double agent inside the Empire... someone to help me win this war.
I know Imperial Intelligence inside and out. I'll do whatever's necessary.
I'm ready, sir.
How exactly do you pick these code names?
Why call me "Legate"?
You don't know Centran sabacc? We should play sometime.
My colleagues will never see the shot coming.
My old loyalties are dead.
Let's hope they never need to.
One more thing before you go--and I'm sorry to say this--keyword: onomatophobia. Thesh protocol, phase one.
Thesh protocol engaged. Shutting down.
Don't know if you can hear me anymore....
Mind control. Brain damage. Inevitable.
This is everything we have.
...discuss this with no one.
Half an hour. Wake up.
What just happened?
I have a bad feeling...
You've made a big mistake.
I'm awake. Awaiting orders.
Let's walk through some exercises. Sit down.
Now jump, please.
Aim your rifle.
Revert to phase zero. You can talk now.
You brainwashed me. I don't know how, but....
How are you doing this?
I came to you in good faith. This is how you reward me?
You betrayed me.
It's unfair. I won't argue.
Is there anything I can do for you?
You're dead. [Shoot him]
Sorry. It only kicks in if you try to disobey.
There's a switch in your head. I just flipped it. You won't be able to tell anyone about us or your programming.
You also won't be able to hurt members of my team. It's all a precaution--in case your real loyalty is still to the Empire.
You can't be doing this. The technology shouldn't exist....
This is impossible.
But it does, and I have it. Don't ask how.
I'm sorry it came to this. But there's still a war going on.
We can still work together.
And principles are the first casualty. I still need you, Legate. You head to Taris, and we can beat the Empire together.
I came here to help, but you're a sick man... and you'll pay for this.
I'll find a way to escape.
I hope you're right. We should all be held accountable.
You're still part of the team, Legate. I still need you on Taris. We'll beat the Empire together.
With the lives we've saved... maybe we'll both find redemption. Dismissed.
Something you need?
